item.description:
"In Atlas Shrugged, Rand tells the story of the U.S. economy crumbling under the weight of crushing government interventions and regulations. Meanwhile, blaming greed and the free market, Washington responds with more controls that only deepen the crisis. Sound familiar?"
—Yaron Brook, "Is Rand Relevant?"
The Wall Street Journal, March 15, 2009

Substitute auto industry for railroad, freeloaders for moochers, 'together we can' for 'the good of the many', and today's headlines read like they came from Rand's dystopian novel. Come discuss the similarities and differences at our next Salon.

group.name: The Boston Ayn Rand Meetup Group

item.name: Rand Redux : Are current news headlines straight from Atlas Shrugged?
